TAN CHEE KEONGManaging DirectorHenry Tan possesses extensive experience in the payments space. He was the Head of Payments Consulting for Singapore  Thailand & the Global Client Group for the APAC region at American Express  where he leads a team of payment consultants to develop strategy and manage the delivery of new payment platforms and products across the region.Prior to his appointment at American Express  Mr Tan was the Group Head of Commercial Cards & Merchant Acquiring at Citibank Singapore where he led the team entering into B2B payments  collaborating with Fintech partners and key global merchants.Mr Tan graduated from Edinburgh Napier University with a Bachelorâ€™s in Human Resource management with Financial Management. ğŸ‰Pika World Daily Review â€“ 4 Oct 2022ğŸ‰ğŸŸEquity market stable after a rocky past quarterğŸ•¹Stock market remains firmer after it suffered major months as bond yields retreated.It has also been a dark period for bonds holders as prices fall with rising yields.A sense of relief was seen as pressure was off given a more risk on sentiment. The swing in the market arises as participants adjust their expectation on the pace of rake hikes and how long such cycles tend to last.ğŸ¤Two-Year Bond Yield moderatingğŸš‘The yield is often seen as a measure of investorsâ€™ expectation of where the Fedâ€™s fund rate will hold. Current level is for it to hit 4.1% after hitting a high of 4.3%ğŸ’UK back track gives new lightğŸ’The UK chancellor has pulled back plan to reduce to cut tax rates for high earners.It was part of a broader spending plan which would spur demand and exacerbate the cycles of inflation.The spending was not within the limit of the governmentâ€™s coffer  and thus any borrowing ignite fear of aggressive spending that push up Glit yield further weakening the fiscal strength.ğŸ“®What's on the menu today?ğŸ“–At 9pm  FOMC member Williams will speak and 15 minutes later  Mester will deliver her speech too.Factory order will be released at 10pm and we expects a growth of 0.3% compare to a decline of 1.0% in the prior period .The biggest highlight comes at 10pm when we will receive the JOLTs Job Opening will moderate to 10.77M compared to 11.239M in the previous period.It is 4 October  Tuesday  at 1.15 pm in Singapore and 1.15 am in New York. The Business TimesMAS launches ESG Impact Hub to drive collaboration between stakeholdersTHE Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) has launched a hub in the business district of Singapore to house startups  financial institutions and other stakeholders focused on ESG initiatives.

Recently  keep seeing the word ESG pop up in the financial media. Seems like it ESG I slowly getting more relevance and important as time goes by.Did some simple research to understand more .In a nutshell Environmental  social  and governance (ESG) investing refers toa set of standards for a company's behavior used by socially conscious investors to screen potential investments. Environmental criteria consider how a company safeguards the environment  including corporate policies addressing climate change  for example.

If there is an ESG Theme play  what SGX counters could fall under this category. Perhaps good to research more and form a watchlist of counters which focus and practice good ESG initiatives.This way  we are ahead of the game and can find good counters with relevance to this and positioned in since it is getting more and more spotlight

Seems like 1 counter which is currently illiquid and resting which is well aligned to future possible ESG theme plays in view of the business that they are in  and also the name they have changed to recently . It is non other than H2G Green (formerly known as P5 capital).At current price $0.022/$0.023 seems a good bargain for mid to long term players since the last placement done was $0.027 and most of the past activities in trading was at $0.027 to $0.034 region.Perhaps can watchlist for the time being. Current price is bargain but no liquidity here and as we all know liquidity comes at a premium . If we want to buy cheap  usually counter is at illiquid stage.Source:https://p5capital.com.sg/green-energy/
